title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
description:
Given the root of a binary tree represented as a nested list, return the **level order traversal** of its nodes' values (i.e., from left to right, level by level).

The tree is represented as a list where `None` indicates an absent node. For example, `[3, 9, 20, None, None, 15, 7]` represents:

```
    3
   / \
  9  20
    /  \
   15   7
```

Implement a function that builds the tree from this list and returns the level-order traversal as a list of lists.
constraints: The number of nodes is in the range [0, 2000].
